resources.string:
Disclaimer: 
OpenVPN Settings comes without any warranty and is beta software. It might drain your battery quickly or otherwise influence the performance of your phone. Use it at your own risk. 

Prerequisites: 
- installed openvpn binary 
- tun in kernel or tun.ko 

OpenVPN Settings is being developed on current releases of CyanogenMod (4.2.13 or greater), which includes the openvpn binary and tun. 

Debugging: 
Use adb logcat on your host. OpenVPN Settings currently relies heavily on adb logcat to give you all information about what is going on. This comes in handy especially when setting up a new tunnel. 

Setup: 
1. Connect your phone via USB to your computer. 
2. Create a directory named openvpn at the root of your sdcard. 
3. Copy your certificates and *.config files into that directory (The config files need to end in .config ). 
4. You might need to hit refresh from the menu. 
5. Start adb logcat on your computer. 
6. Open activity OpenVPN Settings and enable your tunnel. 

About 
OpenVPN Settings 0.2beta
